title: Riot is this really the direction you want to take your game?
body:
I would really love a Rioter to sincerely explain to me how the current state of the game is in any way healthy or fun.

Here are two examples literally just taken from the last 2 ranked games i played but this happens nearly every game.

1. **1 +1/2 item Vi with no ultimate** instantly killing me from 80%
https://webmshare.com/Dd1jQ

https://imgur.com/a/9j0SE 

2.** Diana with literally not even 1 item complete**  instantly dropping me from full + lux shield to about 5%
https://webmshare.com/dvNzV

https://imgur.com/a/CR1EG

Are you guys serious with the current state of damage in this game? Champions with literally no items have assassin level burst? 
Where is the counterplay? Where is the fairness? Whats the point of assassins if half your roster has the ability to instantly kill without any items?

I mean this is just stupid its not even fun. The fact that you wont even acknowledge this issue with the community is just ridiculous.

replies.body:
Honestly both of these examples look fine to me given game state.

Clip 1)

A level down Zoe vs a Triforce Vi. You facetanked nearly her full non-ultimate combo (Q, E + 3 hit passive of W, blue smite) and _you had bought no armor items_. Zoe is one of the squishiest champions in the game for good reason -- you shouldn't have even been that close in the first place. Proper gameplay would be to wait for your Garen to engage and then follow up, but you were impatient, and died as a result of that.

Clip 2)

You shut the clip off here, but you didn't die here. It's too early on into the game for you to have any MR (you bought your MR 15 minutes into the game, after this clip) and the Diana bought these items: {{item:1056}} {{item:1056}} {{item:3145}} {{item:1058}} {{item:3113}}. He had a nearly completed Luden's ON TOP of a Hextech revolver; a build that is pretty useless in any teamfight scenario, but indexes heavily into upfront burst. I'd argue that if Diana doesn't nearly kill you here that our item system is heavily flawed given that she landed her QRR + electrocute on you and you're a squishy mage that hasn't itemized towards MR at all. 

When you're playing squishy artillery mages, you are vulnerable to assassin burst patterns and need to adjust your positioning accordingly :).

I think upfront burst can be problematic in our game currently (Dark Harvest in tandem with Duskblade feels ridiculous to play against), but don't think either example here is sufficient to prove your argument.

Imo, that's a serious problem with the game that's only been doubled down on since the juggernaut patch. As you mentioned, this Vi went for maximum damage output, which is exactly what Zoe did. But when both champs go for max damage, the Vi is still tanky enough to survive Zoe with enough damage to still burst Zoe. 

This disparity exists with no rhyme or reason, and there are exceptions to disprove every rule. There are squishy melee, tanky ranged, all degrees of cc, skill shot & point and click, etc. It just comes down to this: some champs get to have durability and burst, and others don't. Why? >Honestly both of these examples look fine to me given game state.

And therein lies the problem. If you are arguing that everything here is working as intended, then the problem is that your intentions are bad. These examples should not look fine or intentional, because they are not fun.

In both examples, we have characters that are not burst mages or assassins discombobulating people from 100-0 nearly instantaneously and with extremely reliable, nigh-unavoidable patterns. If each of them had just a _little_ bit more damage, these would be truly instant deaths.

Now, this SOUNDS right on paper: I bought damage, therefore, I should do damage. However, is it really FUN to have Diana (or similar characters) land a single accurate ability and be killed nearly instantly by her because you dared step into range? Is it really FUN to have Vi (or similar characters) dash-burst-cc you from fog and stat-check your health bar and character pick instantly before the stun even ends? Is it FUN when almost every optimal build for winning is "kill them in one hit?" Is that fun to you? 

The answer (hopefully obviously) should be no. It's not fun. It's ridiculous to play against. Someone's **burst pattern** should not be so **reliable** to the point where the only counter-play is to _not be within 1000 units_. That's not counter-play, it's not-play. That's the opposite of play. Your play is to not play the game near them. Why did you give assassins 'windows of opportunities' when other characters do the same thing but without those? At least when Nunu _literally kills you in one hit_ with full damage, he EARNED it.

This is not FUN. Your idea of FUN is flawed. League of Legends is not Rocket Tag. If this is working as intended, change your intention. If these examples look fine to you, let's start with your definition of fine.
